comments.body: What are the actual restrictions on this type? Could this just be `new () => Intl.DateTimeFormat`?

No, because it can be polyfilled and the constructor definition should match exactly as material-ui makes extensive use of DateTimeFormat's standard. a simple `new () => ...` will not cover all cases. But the typings provided by typescript does.
OK, just wondering since I see `typeof` used a lot to mean a constructor type.
for future reference the first two parts of the version are the only ones honored. consider adding a tslint.json file to this package, and that would flag these issues.

Because it is an exception, it is out of code generation.
I do not know the reason, but only `navigation-arrow-drop-right.js` is placed in a strange path. I would like you to see https://github.com/callemall/material-ui/tree/master/src/svg-icons. Other files are `./[category]/[icon].js` but the file is `./navigation-arrow-drop-right.js` :sweat:

Is this line change correct? After update my types I got an error

```
(19,9): error TS2322: Type '{ iconButtonElement: Element; children: (false | Element)[]; }' is not assignable to type 'IntrinsicAttributes & IntrinsicClassAttributes<IconMenu> & Readonly<{ children?: ReactNode; }> & ...'.
  Type '{ iconButtonElement: Element; children: (false | Element)[]; }' is not assignable to type 'Readonly<IconMenuProps>'.
    Types of property 'children' are incompatible.
      Type '(false | Element)[]' is not assignable to type 'ReactElement<MenuItemProps> | ReactElement<MenuItemProps>[] | undefined'.
        Type '(false | Element)[]' is not assignable to type 'ReactElement<MenuItemProps>[]'.
          Type 'false | Element' is not assignable to type 'ReactElement<MenuItemProps>'.
            Type 'false' is not assignable to type 'ReactElement<MenuItemProps>'.
```

Just found the bug from my previous [comment](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/22663/files#r165432206).

The problem is that I'm adding MenuItem conditionally. Example:
```
<MenuItem ... />
{this.props.someCondition &&
    <MenuItem ... />
}
<MenuItem ... />
```

So in my case here the type must be `Array<false|React.ReactElement<MenuItemProps>>`

@andrioli
I found the bug in MenuItem's children, so fixed #22910 .
Your bug is fixed this PR, or not yet fixed?
(what means `Array<false>` ?)

Can you show the sample code which causes the error?

Thank you, I understand.
I created #23387.

Sorry about any inconvenience.

Other elements which have children doesn't define children property. Should I undefine children property?
(like: [Menu](http://www.material-ui.com/#/components/menu).)
